alert.note: Alert for Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 10:22AM CDT until May 05 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Okfuskee. In northeast Oklahoma, Okmulgee. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems. Emergency management reported numerous water rescues overnight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 AM CDT, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 5 to locally 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional storms are expected this afternoon, but should remain isolated. However, rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Boley... Dewar... Schulter... Paden... Grayson... Bearden... Hoffman... Castle... Clearview... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Preston... Welty... Bald Hill... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
